alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Milwaukee; Racine; Walworth (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:09AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Strong line of thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Milwaukee, southeastern Walworth, Racine and Kenosha Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 308 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wind Point to near Pell Lake. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Milwaukee, Kenosha, Racine, Greenfield, Oak Creek, Mount Pleasant, South Milwaukee, Pleasant Prairie, Cudahy, Antioch, Greendale, St. Francis, Lake Geneva, Sturtevant, Union Grove, Paddock Lake, Franklin, Camp Lake, Winthrop Harbor, and Twin Lakes. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 331 and 338. Interstate 41/94 between mile markers 317 and 349. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
